Description:
Detects calls to "get-process" where the output is piped to a "where-object" filter to search for security solution processes.
Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of security software, configurations, defensive tools, and sensors that are installed on a system or in a cloud environment. This may include things such as firewall rules and anti-virus


Author: frack113, Anish Bogati, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Security Software Discovery Via Powershell Script
Query: sourcetype like 'windows-%' eql select * from _source_ where ((scriptblocktext like '%get-process | \?%' or scriptblocktext like '%get-process | where%' or scriptblocktext like '%gps | \?%' or scriptblocktext like '%gps | where%') and (scriptblocktext like '%company -like%' or scriptblocktext like '%description -like%' or scriptblocktext like '%name -like%' or scriptblocktext like '%path -like%' or scriptblocktext like '%product -like%') and (scriptblocktext like '%\*avira\*%' or scriptblocktext like '%\*carbonblack\*%' or scriptblocktext like '%\*cylance\*%' or scriptblocktext like '%\*defender\*%' or scriptblocktext like '%\*kaspersky\*%' or scriptblocktext like '%\*malware\*%' or scriptblocktext like '%\*sentinel\*%' or scriptblocktext like '%\*symantec\*%' or scriptblocktext like '%\*virus\*%'))
